greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes of the form 8k+3 generated recursively. Initial prime is 3. General term is a(n)=Min {p is prime; p divides 2+Q^2; Mod[p,8]=3}, where Q is the product of previous terms in the sequence.
comment: 2+Q^2 always has a prime divisor congruent to 3 modulo 8.
reference: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, Sixth Edition (2007), p. 191.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..15
N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
example: a(3) = 1091 is the smallest prime divisor congruent to 3 mod 8 of 2+Q^2 = 1091, where Q = 3 * 11.
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 18 2006
